soil_type_EDA_column = train_df[soil_type_list].idxmax(axis=1)
soil_type_EDA_column = soil_type_EDA_column.str.replace('Soil_Type', '')
soil_type_EDA_column = soil_type_EDA_column.astype('int32')

source.2bf75f0f:
features_list = list(train_df.columns[1:10])

def make_boxplot(x, y, data):
    _ = sns.boxplot(x=x, y=y, data=data)
    _ = plt.xlabel('Cover Type')
    _ = plt.ylabel('{}'.format(y))
    plt.show()
source.d44a8696:
for i in features_list:
    make_boxplot('Cover_Type', i, train_df)
source.12a365f2: # A quick function and for loop to (box) plot the first ten features
source.26e0d97f: # Exploratory data analysis Just trying to get a quick feel for the data set. Simple histograms and summary statistics are provided on the Kaggle website and will not be explored here. I want to convert the `soil_type` and the `wilderness_area` from binary columns to one categorical column (dtype = int) so I can look at that data first.
